column9: BaO2 contains peroxide ion O2²− with O–O single bond.

column3: Maximum hydrogen bonds by one water molecule:
column9: One water molecule can form 4 H-bonds (2 donors + 2 lone pairs).

column3: Most abundant noble gas in atmosphere:
column9: Atmosphere contains ~0.93% Argon → most abundant noble gas.
SF6 has six sigma bonds → sp3d2 hybridisation → octahedral shape.
Chalcogens include O, S, Se, Te → Group 16 elements.
Ni2+ = d8 → 2 unpaired electrons → μ = √8 = 2.83 BM.
Orange color arises from ligand-to-metal charge transfer (O2− → Cr6+).

column3: Which solid is held by covalent network?
column9: Atoms are bonded through a continuous covalent network (diamond, SiO2).
NH3 = ammine ligand, 6 ligands = hexaammine, oxidation state = +3.

column3: Passing H2S into acidified CuSO4 forms precipitate:
column9: H2S reacts with Cu2+ to form black precipitate of CuS.
